column4: hey, I installed updates on my laptop today and it installed new headers, when I went to reboot my computer it got stuck in a kernel panic
anybody have any idea what was in the new linux headers or whatever
the only way I could get my computer to start was to use grub to go back to the previous version
what was the error? also, did it happen more than once?
it happens everytime I start the computer, looks like something about paging and virtual memory
what was the precise error?
unable to handle kernel paging request was what the bulk of the messages were
is there a way I can get those errors in one of the logs?
check for older versions of /var/log/dmesg
also, it installed a new kernel package along with the headers, right?

believe so, I didn't really pay too much attention to what it was installing but I saw the linux kernel stuff in there and took note because I knew I'd have to recompile my wireless drivers to get them to work
another interesting bit of trivia is that I was able to boot successfully into the new kernel mod when I used recovery mode
do you specify any boot options for your kernels?
so I'm not sure exactly what the difference is between recovery mode and normal boot, but when I booted into recovery mode and got the prompt I hit resume normal boot and it works
should just be default stuff
might be a bug in the package...i didn't manage to find a recent bug report discussing this for ubuntu 8.10.
I probably should've mentioned, I'm on 8.04
well, as long as you've got it working, might as well leave it in place, and see if another kernel package update isn't forthcoming shortly :-) or, consider an upgrade to 8.10?
I guess I can do that, I tried upgrading to 8.10, but the network manager was....shall I say, not a great fit, and the wireless driver in 8.10 for my laptop left loads to be desired
maybe best to leave well enough alone, in that case.
yeah, I'm hoping that 9.04 will fix some problems that I have with 8.10, and it probably will
